title: Gated Geocoder
description:
This gated API computes the physical locations (i.e., latitude and longitude) and correct, standardized forms of civic and non-civic addresses in British Columbia. CORS is enabled for any domain. To request an apikey, please contact the [DataBC Help Desk](https://forms.gov.bc.ca/databc-contact-us/)  
Please read our [data collection notice](https://github.com/bcgov/api-specs/blob/master/COLLECTION_NOTICE.md#collection-notice)

actions.title: addresses.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents the set of geocoded and standardized sites and intersections whose address best matches a given query address.

addressString.description:
Examples: 525 Superior Street, Victoria, BC
301-780 Blanshard St, Victoria, BC
Johnson St and Government St, Victoria, BC.
Civic or intersection address as a single string. See addressString

locationDescriptor.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

maxResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

echo.description: If true, include unmatched address details such as site name in results.

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

minScore.description: The minimum score required for a match to be returned. See minScore

matchPrecision.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to include in results. See matchPrecision

matchPrecisionNot.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to exclude from results. See matchPrecisionNot

siteName.description: A string containing the name of the building, facility, or institution (e.g., Duck Building, Casa Del Mar, Crystal Garden, Bluebird House).See siteName

unitDesignator.description: The type of unit within a house or building. See unitDesignator

unitNumber.description: The number of the unit, suite, or apartment within a house or building.

unitNumberSuffix.description: A letter that follows the unit number as in Unit 1A or Suite 302B.

civicNumber.description: The official number assigned to a site by an address authority. See civicNumber

civicNumberSuffix.description: A letter or fraction that follows the civic number (e.g., the A in 1039A Bledsoe St). See civicNumberSuffix

streetName.description: The official name of the street as assigned by an address authority (e.g., the Douglas in 1175 Douglas Street). See streetName

streetType.description: The type of street as assigned by a municipality (e.g., the ST in 1175 DOUGLAS St). See streetType

streetDirection.description: The abbreviated compass direction as defined by Canada Post and B.C. civic addressing authorities. See streetDirection

streetQualifier.description: Example: the Bridge in Johnson St Bridge. The qualifier of a street name. See streetQualifier

localityName.description: The name of the locality assigned to a given site by an address authority. See localityName

provinceCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 Sub-Country Code. The code for British Columbia is BC.

localities.description: A comma separated list of locality names that matched addresses must belong to. For example, setting localities to Nanaimo only returns addresses in Nanaimo

notLocalities.description: A comma-separated list of localities to exclude from the search.

bbox.description: Example: -126.0792,49.7628,-126.0163,49.7907. A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) that limits the search area. See bbox

centre.description: Example: -124.01659,49.2296. The coordinates of a centre point (x,y) used to define a bounding circle that will limit the search area. This parameter must be specified together with 'maxDistance'. See centre

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

extrapolate.description: If true, uses supplied parcelPoint to derive an appropriate accessPoint. See extrapolate

parcelPoint.description: The coordinates of a point (x,y) known to be inside the parcel containing a given address. See parcelPoint

actions.title: intersections.near.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents intersections near a given point

point.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearest site will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

maxResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

minDegree.description: The minimum degree an intersection can have to be included in results. A dead-end has a degree of 1.

maxDegree.description: The maximum degree an interesection can have to be included in results. A four-way stop has a degree of 4.

actions.title: intersections.nearest.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents the closest intersection to a given point

point.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearest site will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

minDegree.description: The minimum degree an intersection can have to be included in results. A dead-end has a degree of 1.

maxDegree.description: The maximum degree an interesection can have to be included in results. A four-way stop has a degree of 4.

actions.title: intersections.within.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents all intersections within a given area

bbox.description: Example: -119.51,49.48,-119.53,49.50. A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) used to limit the search area. See bbox

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

maxResults.description: The maximum number of search results

minDegree.description: The minimum degree an intersection can have to be included in results. A dead-end has a degree of 1.

maxDegree.description: The maximum degree an interesection can have to be included in results. A four-way stop has a degree of 4.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

actions.title: occupants.addresses.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents the set of occupants whose addresses best match a given query address. Every occupant has an associated site which has a standardized address and a coordinate location on the Earth.

addressString.description:
Examples: Redfish Elementary --
Redfish Elementary -- Balfour
Redfish Elementary School -- 265 Bryan Rd, Balfour, BC
Occupant name followed by a frontGate delimiter ('--') followed by an optional address

tags.description:
Example: schools;courts;employment
A list of tags separated by semicolons.

locationDescriptor.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

maxResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

echo.description: If true, include unmatched address details such as site name in results.

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

minScore.description: The minimum score required for a match to be returned. See minScore

matchPrecision.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to include in results. See matchPrecision

matchPrecisionNot.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to exclude from results. See matchPrecisionNot

siteName.description: A string containing the name of the building, facility, or institution (e.g., Duck Building, Casa Del Mar, Crystal Garden, Bluebird House).See siteName

unitDesignator.description: The type of unit within a house or building. See unitDesignator

unitNumber.description: The number of the unit, suite, or apartment within a house or building.

unitNumberSuffix.description: A letter that follows the unit number as in Unit 1A or Suite 302B.

civicNumber.description: The official number assigned to a site by an address authority. See civicNumber

civicNumberSuffix.description: A letter or fraction that follows the civic number (e.g., the A in 1039A Bledsoe St). See civicNumberSuffix

streetName.description: The official name of the street as assigned by an address authority (e.g., the Douglas in 1175 Douglas Street). See streetName

streetType.description: The type of street as assigned by a municipality (e.g., the ST in 1175 DOUGLAS St). See streetType

streetDirection.description: The abbreviated compass direction as defined by Canada Post and B.C. civic addressing authorities. See streetDirection

streetQualifier.description: The qualifier of a street name (e.g., the Bridge in Johnson St Bridge)

localityName.description: The name of the locality assigned to a given site by an address authority. See streetDirection

provinceCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 Sub-Country Code. The code for British Columbia is BC.

localities.description: A comma separated list of locality names that matched addresses must belong to. For example, setting localities to Nanaimo only returns addresses in Nanaimo

notLocalities.description: A comma-separated list of localities to exclude from the search.

bbox.description: Example: -126.07929,49.7628,-126.0163,49.7907. A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) that limits the search area. See bbox

centre.description: Example: -124.0165,49.2296. The coordinates of a centre point (x,y) used to define a bounding circle that will limit the search area. This parameter must be specified together with 'maxDistance'. See centre

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

extrapolate.description: If true, uses supplied parcelPoint to derive an appropriate accessPoint. See extrapolate

parcelPoint.description: The coordinates of a point (x,y) known to be inside the parcel containing a given address. See parcelPoint

actions.title: occupants.near.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents occupants near a given point in order of closest to farthest

point.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearest site will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

tags.description:
Example: schools;courts;employment
A list of tags separated by semicolons.

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

maxResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

locationDescriptor.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

excludeUnits.description: If true, excludes sites that are units of a parent site

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

actions.title: sites.near.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents sites near a given point in the order of closest to farthest

point.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearby sites will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

maxResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

locationDescriptor.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

excludeUnits.description: If true, excludes sites that are units of a parent site

actions.title: sites.nearest.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents the site nearest a given point

point.description: Example: -122.377,50.121 Centre point of search. See point

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

locationDescriptor.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

excludeUnits.description: If true, excludes sites that are units of a parent site

actions.title: sites.within.outputFormat.get
actions.description: Represents sites within a given area

bbox.description: Example: -119.51,49.48,-119.53,49.50. A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) used to limit the search area. See bbox

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

maxResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

locationDescriptor.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

excludeUnits.description: If true, excludes sites that are units of a parent site

siteID.description: A unique, but not immutable, site identifier.

outputSRS.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

locationDescriptor.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

setBack.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.
